title: Execute GET request with absolute URL and no authentication
description: Verify that a GET request can be executed successfully using an absolute URL without any authentication method.

steps.description: Add HTTP Request node to the pipeline canvas
Select HTTP method as GET
Input an absolute URL without any template variables
Select authentication type as None
Execute the node
Verify the request executes successfully and the output panel shows HTTP 200 status code
Verify the request URL is exactly as input
Verify the output panel displays request headers, empty query parameters, request body as empty, and the response data correctly

title: Execute POST request with URL template variables and Basic Authentication
description: Verify that a POST request executes correctly with URL containing template variables resolved at runtime and using Basic Auth authentication.

steps.description: Add HTTP Request node to the pipeline canvas
Select HTTP method as POST
Input a URL with template variables like '{{input.apiBase}}/resource'
Select authentication type as Basic Auth and enter username and password
Provide request body as JSON with template variables for some fields
Execute the node with context input providing values for template variables
Verify template variables are resolved correctly before sending
Verify the Authorization header contains the Basic Auth credentials correctly encoded
Verify the request body matches the templated and rendered JSON
Verify the response status and body are shown correctly in the output panel

title: Headers and query parameters with JSON editor and dynamic templating
description: Verify that headers and query parameters can be configured using JSON editors supporting template variables and toggling fields on/off, and that these are correctly included in the request.

steps.description: Add HTTP Request node and set method to GET
Enter a valid request URL
Open headers JSON editor and input headers including template variables such as 'X-Custom-Header': '{{config.token}}'
Toggle some header fields on and off
Open query parameters JSON editor and input some query parameters with template variables
Execute the node providing context values for template variables
Verify that only toggled-on header fields are sent
Verify template variables in headers and query parameters are properly resolved
Verify the final request URL includes the correctly encoded query parameters
Verify the output panel shows the reflected headers and query parameters as sent

title: Request body with different content types and templating
description: Verify support for JSON, Form Data, Form URL Encoded, raw text bodies, as well as use of template expressions in body content.

steps.description: Add HTTP Request node and select POST method
Configure request body as JSON with template variables embedded
Execute node and verify POST body is sent as application/json
Verify request body matches JSON rendered from template variables
Change body type to Form Data and input key-value pairs with templated values
Execute node and verify correct multipart/form-data encoding and templated values applied
Verify Form Data body fields correctly match rendered template values
Change content type to Form URL Encoded and input templated key-value pairs
Execute node and verify application/x-www-form-urlencoded body with templated substitutions
Verify the body is properly encoded query string matching template evaluation
Change body type to Raw Text and input template expression string
Execute node
Verify raw text body is sent exactly as rendered from template

title: Authentication methods validation: Basic Auth, Bearer Token and Custom Headers
description: Verify that each supported authentication method sets the correct headers and payloads as per specification.

steps.description: Add HTTP Request node and set method to GET
Select Basic Auth, enter valid username and password
Execute the request
Verify Authorization header contains 'Basic' with base64 encoded credentials
Change authentication to Bearer Token and enter token string
Execute the request
Verify Authorization header contains 'Bearer' followed by token
Change authentication to Custom Header and configure header key-value pairs
Execute the request
Verify the custom headers are included properly in the request

title: Response panel displays detailed request/response with multiple views and error states
description: Verify the output panel shows execution status, HTTP status code, request and response headers and bodies, and supports viewing response in table, JSON and schema formats. Verify error message display with network errors and HTTP error statuses.

steps.description: Execute a successful HTTP request
Verify the output panel shows HTTP status code and execution details
Verify request and response headers and bodies are visible correctly
Switch responses views between Table, JSON and Schema tabs
Verify all views render the response data accurately
Execute a request to a non-existing endpoint triggering 404
Verify error message and response body details are shown in error panel
Simulate a network failure (e.g. no internet connection)
Verify network error message is displayed with suggestions in output panel

title: Template variable syntax validation and live preview
description: Verify that template variables are validated in real-time for URL, headers, query params, and request body, and invalid syntax is flagged, preventing node execution.

steps.description: Input an invalid templated URL such as '{{input.missing'
Verify validation error is shown immediately with descriptive message
Input header JSON with invalid template syntax
Verify validation error displayed preventing node execution
Correct the template syntax in all fields
Verify live validation passes with no errors and variable previews are shown

title: Execution engine integration and logging verification
description: Verify that the node integrates correctly with the pipeline execution engine, capturing full request and response data in logs accessible through the pipeline store, and that chaining response data to subsequent nodes is supported.

steps.description: Execute HTTP Request node within a pipeline with proper inputs
Verify the execution engine logs contain full request method, URL, headers, body, response status, headers, and body
Chain output from HTTP Request node to a subsequent node using the execution context
Verify the subsequent node receives the correct parsed response data as input

title: Advanced options: timeout, follow redirects, SSL verification, and response format
description: Verify that timeout settings abort long requests, follow redirects can be toggled, SSL verification can be enabled/disabled, and response format options (raw, parsed JSON, etc.) render accordingly.

steps.description: Configure HTTP Request node with a very low timeout
Execute a request expected to take longer than timeout
Verify the request is aborted and timeout error message is displayed
Toggle follow redirects off and execute a request to a URL that returns HTTP 3xx
Verify the response status is the redirect code and request does not follow
Disable SSL verification and execute a request to a server with self-signed cert
Verify the request succeeds without SSL error
Set response format to raw text and execute a request
Verify the response body is displayed as raw text in the output panel

title: Error handling with retries and full error visibility
description: Verify that when network or HTTP errors occur, detailed error information including response body and actionable retry suggestions are shown, and retry logic can be triggered.

steps.description: Execute a request to a server returning HTTP 500
Verify error panel displays HTTP code, response body, stack trace if available, and retry suggestion
Trigger the retry action from the error panel
Verify the request is retried and new response or error is shown correctly
Simulate network disconnection mid-request
Verify network error message is displayed with details and retry option

title: Negative test: Invalid HTTP method selection
description: Verify the node handles unsupported or invalid HTTP methods gracefully by preventing execution and showing appropriate error messages.

steps.description: Manually set the HTTP method to an unsupported value via configuration
Verify validation error is shown preventing node execution

title: Edge case: Empty URL and missing required fields
description: Verify that an empty URL or other required fields not set trigger validation errors and disable execution.

steps.description: Leave the URL field empty in node configuration
Verify input validation error about missing URL is shown
Attempt to execute node
Verify execution is prevented and informative error is displayed

title: Relative URL resolution
description: Verify that relative URLs are correctly resolved against a base URL defined in the pipeline environment or node configuration before the request is sent.

steps.description: Configure a relative URL such as '/api/v1/data'
Ensure base URL is defined in pipeline context or node configuration
Execute the node
Verify the actual request URL sent is the base URL concatenated with the relative path

title: Encoding and special characters handling in query parameters and headers
description: Verify that special characters and encoding in query parameters and headers are handled correctly and transmitted as expected.

steps.description: Set query parameters with values containing spaces, unicode, and reserved URL characters
Set headers with special characters and verify encoding
Execute the HTTP Request node
Verify query parameters are URL encoded correctly in the request
Verify headers maintain integrity and are accepted by server

title: Consistency of default HTTP method selection
description: Verify that the node defaults to POST method if no HTTP method is selected explicitly, and that the UI dropdown reflects this default.

steps.description: Add HTTP Request node and leave HTTP method unset
Verify the HTTP Method dropdown shows POST as the selected/default value
Execute the node with minimal URL configuration
Verify the request method used in the sent request is POST
